thread.title: Cops: Firefighter beat up homeless man over slow food order - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Cops: Firefighter beat up homeless man over slow food order - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Cops: Firefighter beat up homeless man over slow food order - Massachusetts news
text:
BROOKLINE, Mass. (AP) — A Brookline firefighter has been arrested after police say he beat up a homeless man for taking too long to order his food at a restaurant.
Police say 37-year-old Joseph Ward, of Boston, punched the man in the face five to seven times, kicked him and threw food and a bottle at him outside of Anna’s Taqueria in Brookline on Sunday night.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The victim was taken to the hospital with a laceration to his eyebrow.
WFXT-TV reports Ward did not answer the door Monday night. He is charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon.
Town Administrator Mel Kleckner says officials are aware of Ward’s arrest and he’s been placed on administrative leave pending further investigation.
